meanings.sent1: The old, abandoned house had a ghostly atmosphere that sent shivers down my spine.
meanings.sent2: The ghostly figure floated silently through the dark hallway.
meanings.sent3: The ghostly sounds coming from the attic were just the wind playing tricks on us.
meanings.sent4: Her ghostly pale face in the moonlight made her look like a spirit from another world.
meanings.sent5: The ghostly presence in the room made the hairs on the back of my neck stand up.

meanings.definition: Resembling or characteristic of a ghost
meanings.sent1: The fog was so thick that it created a ghostly effect, obscuring everything in sight.
meanings.sent2: The ghostly apparition seemed to glide effortlessly across the room.
meanings.sent3: The ghostly reflection in the mirror was actually just a trick of the light.
meanings.sent4: Her ghostly white dress billowed in the wind as she walked through the cemetery.
meanings.sent5: The ghostly figure in the painting appeared to be reaching out to the viewer.

meanings.definition: In a way that suggests the presence of ghosts
meanings.sent1: The mist swirled ghostly around the old graveyard, creating an eerie atmosphere.
meanings.sent2: The wind howled ghostly through the empty corridors of the haunted mansion.
meanings.sent3: The children giggled ghostly as they told spooky stories around the campfire.
meanings.sent4: The shadows danced ghostly on the walls as the candle flickered in the draft.
meanings.sent5: The moonlight illuminated the room ghostly, casting strange shadows on the floor.
